intro: Brassica oleracea subvar. alba, commonly known as cauliflower, is a cool-season crop belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its dense, white curd composed of tightly packed florets, which develop from the flower buds. The plant typically grows to a height of 40–100 cm and has smooth, dark green leaves. It thrives in temperate climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. Cauliflower is a biennial plant but is usually cultivated as an annual for its edible head.
